skill.name: data-substrate-analysis
skill.description: Analyze fundamental data primitives, type systems, and state management patterns in a codebase. Use when (1) evaluating typing strategies (Pydantic vs TypedDict vs loose dicts), (2) assessing immutability and mutation patterns, (3) understanding serialization approaches, (4) documenting state shape and lifecycle, or (5) comparing data modeling approaches across frameworks.
skill.summary: Analyze fundamental data primitives, type systems, and state management patterns in a codebase. Use ...
skill.author: Dowwie

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and analysis guidance. No code execution, network access, filesystem operations, or external command execution. Contains no risk factors.

content.user_title: Analyze data primitives and type systems
content.value_statement: Understanding data modeling patterns is critical for building maintainable AI agent frameworks. This skill provides structured analysis of typing strategies, mutation patterns, and serialization approaches to make informed architectural decisions.
actual_capabilities: Locates and identifies type definition files (types.py, schema.py, models.py, state.py)
Classifies typing strategies as strict (Pydantic), structural (TypedDict), or loose (dict)
Analyzes mutation patterns distinguishing in-place modification from copy-on-write approaches
Documents serialization methods including json(), dict(), pickle, and custom implementations
Evaluates validation boundaries and nesting depth in data structures
limitations: Does not execute or modify code - only analyzes existing patterns
Does not access external APIs or network resources
Does not install dependencies or run build commands
Requires codebase to contain identifiable type definition files

use_cases.title: Compare typing approaches
use_cases.description: Evaluate Pydantic vs TypedDict vs dataclasses for your agent framework architecture decisions.

use_cases.title: Audit state management
use_cases.description: Identify mutation risks and immutability violations in existing codebase state handling.

use_cases.title: Document serialization strategy
use_cases.description: Analyze serialization patterns and document round-trip safety across your data models.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Type Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze typing in a new codebase
prompt_templates.prompt: Use data-substrate-analysis to examine the type definitions in this codebase. Identify the typing strategy (Pydantic, Dataclass, TypedDict, or loose dicts) and list the key data primitives with their locations.

prompt_templates.title: Mutation Pattern Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply data-substrate-analysis to audit the mutation patterns. Report whether state updates use in-place modification or copy-on-write. Flag any risky mutable patterns found.

prompt_templates.title: Serialization Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Use data-substrate-analysis to document the serialization approach. Check for pickle usage (security risk), validate implicit vs explicit serialization, and verify round-trip safety.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative Framework Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run data-substrate-analysis on Framework A and Framework B. Generate a comparative matrix showing typing strategy, mutation patterns, serialization method, and validation boundaries for each.

output_examples.input: Analyze the type system in this agent framework codebase
output: Typing Strategy: Pydantic BaseModel with V2 migration
Mutation: Mixed - uses model_copy() for updates but list.append() for message history
Serialization: model_dump_json() for API, model_dump() for internal
Risk: Message history mutable via .append() - consider copy-on-write

best_practices: Use Pydantic BaseModel for type-safe data with automatic validation at boundaries
Prefer copy-on-write (model_copy, dataclasses.replace) over in-place mutation
Avoid pickle for serialization due to security vulnerabilities
Make optional fields explicit rather than relying on implicit None
anti_patterns: Using loose Dict[str, Any] without type boundaries at API ingress/egress
Mixing mutable and immutable patterns inconsistently within the same data structure
Implicit serialization without explicit to_dict() or from_dict() methods
Storing sensitive data in objects that use pickle serialization

faq.question: What typing strategies does this skill detect?
faq.answer: Pydantic BaseModel, Dataclass, TypedDict, NamedTuple, and loose dict patterns are identified.

faq.question: What are the safe mutation patterns?
faq.answer: Copy-on-write using Pydantic model_copy(), dataclasses.replace(), or immutable data structures is recommended.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use codebase-mapping first to find type files, then feed findings into comparative-matrix for framework decisions.

faq.question: Is my data safe during analysis?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill that reads code patterns without executing or transmitting data.

faq.question: What serialization methods are flagged as risky?
faq.answer: Pickle is flagged as a security risk due to arbitrary code execution vulnerabilities during deserialization.

faq.question: How is this different from a type checker?
faq.answer: This analyzes architectural patterns and design decisions rather than static type correctness. It focuses on mutation, serialization, and state lifecycle.
